intro: Hydnocarpus wrayi, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, simple leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. Its latex, which is toxic, has been used traditionally in various applications, including as a pesticide and in the production of rubber.
